node.title: Trivia Rivals Become Life Partners
node.description: Angela Newman and Anthony Falco met as competitors at a New Jersey barâ€™s trivia events. The night they became teammates, everything changed.
node.content: ["Question: Name the couple who met eight years ago while playing a Trivial-Pursuit-like game at the Brass Rail Bar and Grill in Matawan, N.J., and fell in love despite a 30-year disparity in age.", "Answer: Angela Newman, 30, of Matawan, N.J., and Anthony Falco, 60, of Staten Island.", "\u201cAnthony was so smart, it seemed as if he knew the answer to every question he was asked, he was very impressive,\u201d said Ms. Newman, who works remotely as a senior account executive for sales at Indeed, an employment listings website.", "\u201cAs smart as he was, it did me little good because he was always on a different team,\u201d said Ms. Newman, who graduated from Rutgers. \u201cBut I would look over at him every once in a while and I could tell that he loved answering trivia questions as much as I did.\u201d", "Mr. Falco, who was a divorced father of two by the time he met Ms. Newman, had also noticed her great enthusiasm for the game, among other things.", "\u201cI had seen her many times and thought she was very beautiful and, from where I sat, she seemed very friendly,\u201d said Mr. Falco, who graduated from St. John\u2019s University and works as a settlements analyst for Broadridge, a financial services company based in Newark, N.J.", "The pair\u2019s relationship evolved beyond fellow competitors one night in February 2013, when Ms. Newman walked into the bar and noticed Mr. Falco sitting with a few of her friends.", "\u201cI found out he was on my team that night,\u201d Ms. Newman said. \u201cThat changed everything.\u201d", "After becoming teammates, both said that they became fast friends and started to spend time together outside of the Brass Rail.", "\u201cWe had a lot of things in common,\u201d Mr. Falco said. \u201cWe like the same kind of music, movies and TV shows, and we have a similar sense of humor, so we made a very good connection and I fell for her pretty quickly.\u201d Ms. Newman\u2019s feelings for Mr. Falco evolved just as fast, she said.", "[Click here to binge read this week\u2019s featured couples.]", "But when their relationship crossed a platonic line in October 2015, Ms. Newman said that their difference in age was initially hard to swallow by her parents and some other friends and family.", "\u201cIn those early days, we had to deal with a lot of anger and pushback from family and friends,\u201d she said. \u201cOf everyone involved, it hit my father the hardest; he had his reservations at first,\u201d Ms. Newman added. \u201cIt\u2019s not that he didn\u2019t like Anthony, he just wanted to make sure that this is what I wanted to do.\u201d", "But in the years that followed, she said, \u201cmost of the people who were upset about the age thing have now gotten over it,\u201d including her father. \u201cHe would say \u2018I see it too,\u2019 so we\u2019ve pretty much gotten over that hurdle.\u201d", "The couple became engaged Aug. 5, 2020. As part of the proposal, Ms. Newman said Mr. Falco presented her with a bottle of her favorite wine that did not feature its label, but another one that read: \u201cWill you marry me?\u201d", "They were married Nov. 26 at the Park Ch\u00e2teau Estate and Gardens in East Brunswick, N.J. Pastor Tom McKenna, a Protestant minister, officiated before 150 guests, most of whom were fully vaccinated. They included the bride\u2019s father, Frank Newman, mother, Lois Marr, and stepfather, Kenny Marr, as well as the groom\u2019s children; his son Patrick Falco, 25, was his best man, and his daughter Allie Falco, 23, was one of Ms. Newman\u2019s bridesmaids.", "\u201cThey are both wonderful people,\u201d she said of Mr. Falco\u2019s children, \u201cand we have a lot of mutual respect for each other.\u201d", "The groom said that the couple\u2019s relationship has always \u201cjust felt natural\u201d from the night they became trivia teammates for the first time. \u201cWe knew we wanted to hang out with each other, and we really liked each other\u2019s company. There wasn\u2019t anything awkward about it.\u201d", "The bride agreed.", "\u201cI don\u2019t know if it had anything to do with the age difference,\u201d she said. \u201cBut it was and is a very mature relationship, and that\u2019s what I always wanted.\u201d"]
